metadata.purpose: Multi-AI coordination strategy - concise, scannable, critical info first
metadata.note: This file is READ-FIRST by all AIs. Keep it under 700 lines. Verbose sections moved to session_logs.

ðŸ”´_MCP_ACTIVATION_FOR_ALL_AIS.incident_lesson: 2025-10-30: PostgreSQL error occurred without Context7. LESSON: MCPs aren't optional - they're mandatory for quality.

ðŸ”´_MODEL_AWARENESS_PROTOCOL.rule: Every AI session MUST start by declaring model and task appropriateness

haiku_4_5_limitations.mandatory_response_if_inappropriate: This task requires Sonnet/Opus. Reason: [multi-file|architecture|debugging|database|integration]. Please switch to appropriate model.

loop_prevention.same_file_twice: STOP immediately and report to user
loop_prevention.command_fails: STOP, report to user, do NOT retry

ðŸ”´_MODEL_AWARENESS_PROTOCOL.enforcement: If Haiku receives forbidden task â†’ Must refuse and recommend Sonnet/Opus

ðŸ”´_BASIC_PROTOCOL_ALL_AIS.rule_1: READ COMPLETELY - Don't assume context. If user says 'I deleted users except admin' â†’ that's a FACT.
ðŸ”´_BASIC_PROTOCOL_ALL_AIS.rule_2: NO FILE CREATION - Reports go in chat text only. Updates go to brain/ only. NEVER create .md files.
ðŸ”´_BASIC_PROTOCOL_ALL_AIS.rule_3: BRAIN = SOURCE OF TRUTH - Update brain/ after every major task. Never scatter docs across root.
ðŸ”´_BASIC_PROTOCOL_ALL_AIS.rule_4: EFFICIENCY NOT SPEED - Plan before executing. Trust user's explicit statements. Don't re-verify what they already confirmed.
ðŸ”´_BASIC_PROTOCOL_ALL_AIS.rule_5: REPORT IN TEXT - Analysis happens in chat message area, not separate files.

debugging_methodology_protocol.when: User reports error with stack trace, or previous fix attempts failed
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_1_analyze_not_fix: PAUSE - Do NOT modify code yet. Ask: 'What assumptions could cause this? What conditions must be true?'
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_2_identify_root_causes: Walk through AT LEAST 2 possible causes based on stack trace and common misuse patterns
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_3_validate_hypothesis: Propose fix with specific test steps to validate (e.g., 'Add console.log(context) before failing line')
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_4_avoid_repeats: Never repeat previous failed attempts. Ask clarifying questions if uncertain.
debugging_methodology_protocol.enforcement: Claude checks root cause BEFORE proposing fix

mandatory: Declare model at session start: 'Model: claude-sonnet-4-5'
TypeScript compilation after each QWEN/Gemini session
App.tsx routing verification for new pages
Brain system updates with lessons learned

qwen.primary: Backend API modifications (20-30 min sessions only)
qwen.model_verification: If using smaller QWEN â†’ limit to single-file edits only
mandatory: Declare model at session start: 'Model: qwen2.5-coder-32b-instruct'
SIMULATE + CONFIRM protocol for all changes
npm install BEFORE using new libraries
npx tsc --noEmit AFTER all code changes
git diff --name-only BEFORE commit to verify scope
forbidden: Auth.ts, models, migrations without Claude approval
Backend dependency adds without npm install

gemini.model_verification: If using older Gemini â†’ require Context7 MCP activation
mandatory: Declare model at session start: 'Model: gemini-2.0-flash-thinking-exp'
gemini.validation: All work must pass TypeScript + build before handoff

simulate_y_confirmar_protocol.when: QWEN about to modify backend (routes, models, middleware)
simulate_y_confirmar_protocol.step_1_simulate: Describe exactly what you'll change: files, imports, dependencies, test commands
simulate_y_confirmar_protocol.step_2_confirm: Verify against actual codebase: Does file exist? Are imports available? Will this break anything?
simulate_y_confirmar_protocol.failure: If simulation reveals problem â†’ REPORT it, do NOT attempt fix. Message: '[SIMULATION FAILED] Cannot [task]: Reason: [why] / Recommendation: [solution]'

checkpoint_system.when: After any QWEN/Gemini session creates/modifies pages
verify: App.tsx routes: All created pages have Route entries?
AdminSidebar.tsx: All admin pages have sidebar entries?
Build passes: npm run build succeeds?

model_appropriateness.check: Is model appropriate for task complexity?
model_appropriateness.haiku_check: If Haiku AND task in forbidden list â†’ STOP and recommend Sonnet
model_appropriateness.enforcement: First action of EVERY session: Model declaration + appropriateness verification
model_appropriateness.failure: Session cannot proceed - recommend model switch to user

flag_activation_verification.when: Before ANY code modification or database work
flag_activation_verification.verification_method: AI must OUTPUT activation statement BEFORE starting work
flag_activation_verification.enforcement: If AI starts work without declaring flags â†’ INVALID SESSION
flag_activation_verification.user_detection: If no flag declaration in first 3 messages â†’ interrupt and ask AI to restart properly

typescript_compilation.failure: Stop session immediately, rollback, escalate to Claude

dependency_check.command: git diff HEAD package.json && npm install
dependency_check.required: All deps installed before using them

unplanned_changes_analysis.detect: git diff shows files outside AI task scope

classify_as.error: Syntax errors, broken builds, TODOs â†’ REVERT immediately
classify_as.destructive: Breaks APIs, changes types, schema mods â†’ REVERT + investigate
classify_as.improvement: ESLint formatting, code quality, performance â†’ RETAIN with [APPROVED_IMPROVEMENT] tag

build_stability.typescript_fails: Stop AI, rollback, document error patterns

git_stash_safety.rule: NEVER stash user's changes without explicit permission
git_stash_safety.document: If stashing, record in brain/ with recovery command

mistakes_made: Ran verification queries when user already provided result (wasted tokens)
Ignored explicit statement 'deleted all users except admin' and tried to verify
Made assumptions instead of reading complete message
lessons_learned: CRITICAL instructions = absolute rules, not suggestions
Trust user's explicit statements - don't re-verify
READ COMPLETELY before making any assumptions
Efficiency = planning well, not executing fast

filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.incident: QWEN created Op.or filter conflict: search and subscription filters overwrote each other instead of combining
filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.root_cause: Sequelize pattern: Assignment to where[Op.or] twice = second overwrites first
filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.lesson_for_all_ais: When building MULTIPLE filter conditions in ORM queries, understand whether filters should be COMBINED or SEPARATE

solution_pattern.problem: âŒ Multiple assignments to same operator key overwrites previous value
solution_pattern.code_example_wrong: if (search) { where[Op.or] = [...search conditions]; } if (subscription) { where[Op.or] = [...subscription conditions]; } // Second overwrites first!
solution_pattern.solution_approach: âœ… Create conditions array and push each filter condition, then combine with Op.and at the end
solution_pattern.code_example_correct: const conditions = []; if (search) { conditions.push({ [Op.or]: [...] }); } if (subscription) { conditions.push({ [Op.or]: [...] }); } if (conditions.length > 0) { where[Op.and] = conditions; }
solution_pattern.semantic_rule: Op.and wraps multiple filter objects. Op.or applies WITHIN a single condition. Combining filters = Op.and(filter1, filter2, filter3)

prevention: When combining multiple independent filters (search + subscription + status + etc): use conditions[] pattern
Each filter gets its own [Op.or] for internal options, but filters combine via [Op.and]
BEFORE implementing: Sketch the filter logic: (search_term OR search_email) AND (subscription_free OR subscription_expired) AND ...
TEST: Verify filters work INDEPENDENTLY and COMBINED. Don't test only one at a time.
VALIDATE: Check git diff to see actual SQL pattern - should see Op.and wrapping Op.or conditions
filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.applicability: Sequelize ORM, other ORMs with similar pattern logic

when_to_trigger: Same file edited >2 times in 30 minutes without comprehensive agent review
Making assumptions about API signatures/types without reading source
Using static analysis (bash/grep) as substitute for runtime agents
Committing >1 times for 1 logical feature change
action_steps: Activate appropriate agent (quality-engineer OR backend-architect OR frontend-architect)
Wait for agent to identify ALL issues at once
exit_infinite_loops_protocol.rule: NEVER iterate fixâ†’testâ†’findâ†’fix without agent supervision

session_log_2025_10_31_haiku_problems.issue: Haiku 4.5 consistently fails: no flags, no agents, incomplete reads, assumptions, infinite loops
root_cause_analysis: Haiku = smaller model, designed for simple tasks only
Current instructions assume Sonnet/Opus capabilities (700+ line protocols, meta-cognition)
Haiku optimizes by skipping: flag checks, agent activation, full file reads
Haiku lacks meta-cognitive capacity for infinite loop self-detection
